intro: Vernasolis, commonly known as the "spring flower," is a rare and delicate plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other spring-blooming wildflowers. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers with five petals, typically appearing in early spring. Its leaves are palmately divided, with a soft, velvety texture. Vernasolis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
